p: Zahin et al. [ 126] investigated the antioxidant capacity of H. pubescens by the ferric thiocyanate (FTC) method, thiobarbituric acid (TBA) method and DPPH radical scavenging method. Their results revealed a fair antioxidant effect using the FTC and TBA method, but a very low DPPH radical scavenging activity (20%). In another study conducted by Bhusal, [ 113] H. pubescens bark was evaluated for antioxidant effects, whereby both methanol and ethanol extracts had strong DPPH inhibition activity (methanol extract 96% at 0.1 mg/mL), whereas the hexane extract appeared to have the weakest activity.
